main event: A bright, self-luminous round object was observed in Massapequa Park, New York, on October 5, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed traveling vertically at approximately 10-12,000 feet, then changing to horizontal motion while emitting a bright blue glow and making no sound., The object was about 20-30 feet in diameter., Witnesses indicated that aircraft in the area increased speed and changed direction during the sighting., The object vanished suddenly, resembling the switching off of a light., Initial speculation suggested it could be a Russian satellite or aircraft, but characteristics suggested it was more likely a meteor.
sighted object: a bright, round object in the sky
witness description: A resident of Massapequa Park, New York
